article:
I remember as a small child when we would have these gatherings where someone would come up and ask, "What are you going to be when you grow up?" 
  Well, it   started out   being a cowboy or some super hero. Later it was a fireman, policeman, lawyer ... As I grew older my dreams of the future   _  . When, at last, I was in college, I made up my   _   to become a preacher  as my father.   _   I studied and prepared for that life. I reached 45 _ in the end and I was preaching nearly fulltime for much of my adult life.
 However, for many, there is a "thief" which goes around stealing our   _  . Sometimes, the thief will come as a parent, a  , or a friend, but the   _   thief is, so many times, just   _  . 
   We find ourselves just about reaching the top, and this "small"   _   inside says, "You will never make   _  ." "You can't possibly do this." And on and on the "small" voice   _   some kind of failure. Failure, though, is exactly how dreams are   _  . It is one of the most important tools we have, because it teaches us invaluable   _  . And, when we learn these lessons well, we are ready   _   success.
   The message I always gave my children was that you   are able to  do anything your heart desires. Remember the saying, "Nothing is   _  to a willing heart." There are   no  "overnight" successes, but with determination, it will come. Imagine yourself in the life you dream of   _  . Then in your heart, believe it   _  happen for you. Then work, work, work. You get the picture.
   So, be true to your dream, and don't let anyone   _   it from you--especially yourself.
